Overview:
AOFR has been at the forefront of fiber optic component manufacturing for over 20 years and is a pioneer in the development of highly automated coupler manufacturing processes. AOFR’s unique manufacturing process provides high quality fused fiber components for the global Telecommunications Network, CATV, Test Equipment, Industrial, Sensing and Military & Aerospace markets.

AOFR’s fused fiber products include:

    * Single mode couplers, taps and arrays
    * 1x3 and 1x4 monolithic splitters
    * Single mode attenuators
    * Wavelength Division Multiplexers
    * Multimode couplers
    * Polarization couplers
    * Laser Power Combiners

AOFR also offer the following products:

    * Planar Lightwave splitters
    * Video Overlay WDM’s
    * Fiber Organizer packaging

AOFR’s reputation for performance, quality and reliability is backed by over 70 billion device hours in the field and 5 million device hours of product testing and is supported by a world-wide Sales and Technical Support Network with outstanding Customer Service.

Through a 'white label'​ or 'turn key'​ solution you can provide end-to-end solutions that compete against the big Telco’s. Whether you’re a start up business, existing business, or just want to market to your existing database, we have a suite of products that can offer you incremental revenue streams.  

We help our partners to benefit from our purchansing power, by accessing our extensive Tier 1 Carrier Network without the significant outlay in financial security.  Our flexible structure enables you to choose your business model, your pricing and set your own margins.


OUR COMPANY

At Spark our core business is wholesale telecommunications. Secondly, through our strategic partnerships, we stack technology into a single offering and provide end-to-end solutions to many types of businesses and/or resellers. We love technology but not as much as we love human connection. As much as technology is the future of our world and is constantly evolving at the speed of light, nothing can replace HUMAN interaction, EYE to EYE contact, brain-storming sessions, DRIVE to succeed. Seeing the satisfaction on everyone’s faces when we find the RIGHT SOLUTION for your business.


OUR PROMISE

When it comes to you or your customers transitioning to a new provider, we recognise that while the right price and network options make up much of the decision, a smooth, well-run faultless execution is just as important in keeping your business connected. We have seen the statistics on how many good clients you need to win to overcome one dissatisfied client.  So from our perspective getting it right the first time is imperative to everyone’s success.

LIKE TO KNOW MORE? 
If you have any questions or would like to add a spark to your business,, simply call 1300 927 205 or visit our website - www.sparkwholesale.com.au

Name: IOT Data Centres
Location: Ellengowan Dr, Brinkin, Northern Territory 0810, AU
Overview: IOTDC is a DataCentre Project Developer.   Its core business is the development of a footprint of community integrated facilities that together form what we refer to as a ‘mesh hyperscale data centre’.    In order to do this, we build data centre facilities in sustainable regions where typically local demand is starved of enterprise capability due to physical distance from existing data centre services.   We call this problem “capital city syndrome”.    I.e. in Australia this is closely equated to locations or ‘medium’ population hubs that are at a distance from the major capital cities of Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane and Perth (where there is plenty of data centre capacity).   We have also progressed plans to develop  in SE Asia including India and Nepal.In our mesh, each node may be a hyperscale facility in its own right, but it only evolves into that mature state based on the demand at that geographical location.   We offset development investment risk by only building capacity in a modular fashion when it is needed and by using a Turnkey solution.  This is a proven business model in other parts of the world. Whilst our core offering is data centre services, as our solution is a community integrated offering, what exists inside the facility is also extended to the rest of the community where we offer both IOT solutions, Smart City Ring Infrastructure/Canopies and Backhaul connectivity.   ie we build beyond our four walls.  Where we can, what platforms we adopt in our facility, we offer to the wider community in a transactional consumption model allowing business that normally can’t afford the latest technology to consume as and when they may see the opportunity to differentiate.  We also seek to consume locally offered community services in preference to building or developing our own (As an example we do not build board rooms into the facility and generally push that to commercial buildings nearby).   We are the solution where the market is currently weak.
Address_0: Level 26/100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia

Name: ACN Pacific
Overview:
The ACN story is 2 decades in the making! Today, ACN is the world’s largest direct seller of telecommunications and essential services, having serviced millions of satisfied customers on four continents.

ACN launched operations in January 1993 in Southfield, Michigan, as a long distance agent for a company by the name of LCI International, positioning ACN to take the lead as their consumer sales and marketing arm. LCI was later purchased by Qwest Communications for $4.4 billion, and ACN represented an astonishing one-third of LCI’s business.

ACN’s international expansion started in June 1997, when operations were extended into Canada. Today, ACN markets and provides service in 24 countries, with more countries planned for future expansion.

In July 2000, ACN decided to become a telecommunications company and introduced its very own long distance service: ACN Long Distance. This service set the standard for outstanding long distance service in North America and Canada.

Three years later, on the dawn of its 10-year anniversary, ACN exploded onto the local calling scene, providing customers with the freedom to choose their local phone service provider. Globally, ACN now offers a wide range of telecommunications and essential services including Home & Business Phone, Mobile, Broadband Internet, Digital Phone Services and video phones, Energy, Home Security and Satellite TV.

Today, ACN has offices located throughout North America, Europe, the Pacific and Asia. The company’s tradition of providing consumers with services they need and use every day continues still and is the reason why ACN leaders believe the company’s greatest growth lies ahead.

Overview:
Vertel is an independent Australian licensed telecommunications carrier with over 40 years of experience in servicing some of the Australia’s most demanding Government, Enterprise and Service Provider organisations.

We specialise in the design, build and operation of mission and life critical telecommunications infrastructure and associated network services across Australia. We focus on delivering carrier grade communication networks across Australia in fringe metro, regional and remote locations.

We have pioneered the delivery of Ethernet and Broadband network services through the use of carrier grade microwave access technology in the ‘last mile’ to deliver critical networks even to regional and remote areas. We integrate this independent access network with our own and third party fibre backhaul to create a service that is 100% independent from other major carrier's networks.

As one of the few Australian carriers to achieve the MEF (Metro Ethernet Forum) CE 2.0 certification for our Carrier Ethernet services, we are uniquely positioned to address redundant and primary connectivity in fringe metro, regional and remote Australia. We are the world's first organisation to achieve MEF Carrier Ethernet certification for Microwave services.  

Combined with our private mobile network offerings and extensive data centre interconnects, we are fast becoming the provider of choice for organisations that place the highest of importance on network up-time and service utilisation.

We have offices across the country in Sydney, Coffs Harbour, Brisbane, Melbourne, Perth and Adelaide, with a national Network Operations Center in NSW that proactively monitors our networks 24/7.

Name: Communications Alliance Ltd
Overview: Communications Alliance is the primary telecommunications industry body in Australia. Its membership is drawn from a wide cross-section of the communications industry, including carriers, carriage and internet service providers, content providers, search engines, equipment vendors, IT companies, consultants and business groups.Its vision is to provide a unified voice for the telecommunications industry and to lead it into the next generation of converging networks, technologies and services. The prime mission of Communications Alliance is to promote the growth of the Australian communications industry and the protection of consumer interests by fostering the highest standards of business ethics and behaviour through industry self-governance.Communications Alliance offers a forum for the industry to make coherent and constructive contributions to policy development and debate. By providing leadership on new trends and directions, Communications Alliance fulfils a vital unifying role on behalf of the industry and its members, particularly in areas of competition, innovation and industry development. Communications Alliance believes it is in the best interests of all participants, customers and government that the industry takes responsibility for devising practical, self imposed solutions that are developed by co-operative processes. In doing so, Communications Alliance seeks to facilitate open, effective and ethical competition between service providers while ensuring efficient, safe operation of networks, the provision of innovative services and the enhancement of consumer outcomes.

Name: TC Communications
Location: Unit A3, Cameron Centre, 255 Rawson St, Auburn, NSW 2144, AU
Overview:
Do you have communication problems due to being remote (i.e. out of 3G range) or mobile (in the air, or at sea)? 

We can solve that problem for you.

TC Communications specialises in building primarily mobile/deployable satellite communications systems for military and government customers as well as customers in markets such as media, mining, oil and gas and aid agencies. Whether you need data, voice, or both, we deliver it to you via one of many satellite networks.

The key is knowledge and optimisation. In satcom it's not the price per megabyte, it's how many megabytes you send.

We can deliver voice or data anywhere. We've delivered applications and capability via satellite in every form, from satphones to BGAN, SCADA telemetry to marine broadband, tracking to VSAT. We're experts on the Inmarsat network, but have devised solutions on Iridium, Thuraya, and many VSAT networks.

TC provides non-internet-traversing backhaul for Australian customers who want guaranteed or secure performance. We have a 7x24 help desk for all our customers. 

We have developed our own range of Satcom Gadgets, appliances that enable or optimise working over satcoms. These include devices for your legacy serial devices to communicate over IP-based satcom terminals, interfaces that use satcom and PSTN to give you push-to-talk radio anywhere in the world, least-cost routing between 3G and satcom, and our own satellite PBX.

Name: moip
Overview:
Land line on a mobile well that's different.

"moip"​ is an innovative telecommunications provider that provisions both land lines and mobile numbers to your mobile. 

Through its partners "moip'​ is able to offer a point of difference which is a complete solution, transparent to the user and at a significant cost reduction on the call rates on mobile phones.

This technology currently (patents pending) allows the user to chose either land line or mobile phone call (or both) provisioning from the one device (a mobile phone).

Current ACMA legislation requires land lines to be geographically linked to a fixed position so it is not recommended that the mobile phone originating a land line number be "moved"​ about. That said once the mobile phone is at a "fixed"​ location the land line number can be used at that location with significant savings and the convenience of having all of your communications in the one device.

"moip"​, www.moi-p.com, moi! - it's me.

trademarks and patents pending

Name: Red Button Technologies
Overview:
Red Button Technologies is a telecommunications product development start-up.

Our first product Red Button TM is a cost effective mobile communications tool that supports independent living for those with a latent medical condition that may strike quickly and unpredictably, necessitating urgent assistance.

Red Button TM uses patented ICT to manage group communications between an individual’s standard/smart mobile and a predefined group of friendlies.  The customer uses speed dial or an App to ring Red Button TM, which then truly simultaneously calls all members of the group. 

Red Button TM detects the first Friendly that responds (ignoring answering machines) and terminates the other dial-outs.  It enables the receiving party to conference in 000 [911 in USA] or other members of the group if necessary.    

Red Button TM is operational.  We now looking for $VC to develop the business with key channel partners (eg Private Health Funds).  We have an energetic team of seasoned professionals ready to go.

Name: Jabiru Limited
Overview:
For the first time in Australian history, NewSat intends to launch and operate its very own next generation independant satellite in GEO-stationary orbit.

The satellite named Jabiru-1 takes it’s name from the indigenous term for ’stork’ or bird. It’s a comparatively large satellite with many transponders weighing more than five tonnes. It will have a life span of 15 years.

Once launched, Jabiru-1 will further enhance our leadership stance by becoming the only Australian company to offer a total satellite communications service.

Jabiru-1 will unlock bandwidth capacity and satellite coverage that is unavailable today. It will provide our clients with access to greater Ka, C and Ku band coverage.
We are excited to advise, that the program is progressing and is on target.

Name: Comcell (NSW)
Overview:
Comcell  provides installation, commissioning and integration services across Australia as a specialist in carrier mobile networks. These highly technical services delivered by our team of telecommunications technicians revolve around the upgrade and installation of infrastructure to support the expansion of carrier 2G, 3G, 4G and wireless networks.

The scope of works involved from upgrading and swapping out microwave links in major capital cities to encompass the country at large and a variety of technical works. This has included the deployment of new 3G base stations, antenna and feeder systems, along with the expansion of backhaul facilities including civil works and installation and commissioning of backhaul radio links.

Name: Accelerated Concepts, Inc.
Overview: Accelerated Concepts, Inc., a provider of secure, enterprise-grade cellular (LTE) networking solutions, was acquired by Digi International in early 2018. We are pleased to report that this has led to a successful combination of products, technologies, services, and top-notch talent. To build on this momentum and success in 2019, we will complete the next step of merging the Accelerated brand into the Digi brand. This rebranding means we will discontinue using the Accelerated brand and replace it with the Digi brand. For instance, the Accelerated 6310-DX will now simply be renamed the Digi 6310-DX. In addition, the Digi corporate website – www.digi.com – now houses all Accelerated product information, support documents, downloads and product resources. This means, as of April 2, 2019 the Accelerated Concepts website will no longer be available. While the names and brand are transitioning to the Digi brand identity, please know that Accelerated technology and talent remain in place to ensure that current and future lines of cellular routers continue to exceed market expectations. Please visit www.digi.com/accelerated for details and be sure to follow the Digi International company page for any and all future updates. Thank you for your continued support of Digi.

Name: Sky and Space Global Limited
Location: 1202 Hay St, Perth, Western Australia 6005, AU
Overview: SAS is the first company to plan, build and operate a telecommunication commercial network over Nano-Satellites.SAS stands in the forefront of technology, award winner of the Global Excellence Award 2017, People’s NewSpace Company 2016 and Frost & Sullivan Innovation Award 2016, it brings to the world a game-changer technology for the satellite and telecom industry.SAS operates in the field of Nano-Satellites, which is now the most popular type of satellites for diverse commercial usage. The low mass and high capabilities of Nano-Satellites makes them the preferable choice for constellations and applications in the New Space industry.Follow the successful launch of its 3 first satellite (the 3 diamonds) SAS plan to launch 200 satellites, providing equatorial coverage and beyond.The satellites are placed carefully in synchronized orbits that circle the earth almost every hour and half. The satellites communicate between each other and each satellite beams down to in a circular footprint. The constellation thus creates a mesh in the sky where each satellite serves as both as a base station and a router.SAS operates in the S-band frequency range that enables a very small device with patch antenna (8cm) or monopole antenna and low power consumption. The network of SAS is a narrow band communication network suitable for IoT, M2M, personal voice and messaging.

Overview:
iSee™ is a video meeting solution that enables many-to-many crowd collaboration, merging video conferencing with interactive, virtual spaces.

Participants video and audio is streamed in real time via personal webcams into an immersive setting where they can move around freely, form groups, talk and share content just as they would in the real world.

The iSee technology enables large video meetings to take place using an order of magnitude less bandwidth with a higher level of engagement than existing video conferencing systems. These bandwidth savings enable participation in large video meetings by people with limited bandwidth capacity.

Sophisticated technology such as directional audio further supports the illusion of a real-world setting by allowing multiple users to interact in the same space and hold simultaneous conversations, yet hear only those people within earshot, just as in the real world

Name: China Telecom (Australia) Pty Ltd

Overview: China Telecom (Australia) Corporation Limited (CTAU) was established in January 2011. Its inception is another important milestone in China Telecom’s decade of overseas expansion in the Asia-Pacific region. Subsequent to the deployment of the nodes in Hong Kong, Singapore and Japan, the completion of the Australian network node marks China Telecom’s preliminary accomplishment of its network layout of four core nodes in the Asia-Pacific region. These nodes will help China Telecom further extend the reach of its global services and network. Also, as our business continues to expand, branches will be set up in Melbourne, Perth and Brisbane successively apart from CTAU’s headquarters in Sydney. In order to enhance cooperation between Australian and Asia-Pacific operators, and to meet the demands arising from ever-increasing Sino-Australian and international trading activities, CTAU has established international service nodes in Sydney and Perth. This move signals the Company’s intention to strengthen cooperation and explore business opportunities with major telecom operators on the basis of “drawing upon each other’s strengths, and win-win cooperation”, to cooperate with business partners for service quality improvement and joint value creation in the Asia-Pacific region, and to provide a one-stop international communication service including local support for Chinese-funded transnational businesses. CTAU will make full use of China Telecom's international network and rich resources to actively develop the international telecommunications business. It will provide customers with personalized and cost-effective integrated information and communication solutions, and diversified services, including Cloud, International Private Leased Circuit (IPLC), Virtual Private Network (VPN), Internet access and IP Transit, and Internet Data Centre (IDC) services, and rich ICT system integrated industry solutions (e.g. in Banking, Real Estate, Mining, Education industry etc.) Meanwhile, it will also uphold China Telecom’s service philosophy of "Customer First, Service Foremost"​ and continue its dedication to provide one-stop international communication support for multinational enterprises in Australia, as well as provide clients with quality telecommunication services and a full range of guarantees for communication to strengthen and make due contributions to Sino-Australian economic development.
